Data Format Conversion


Functions

void fbMatrixFromAngles (float a[9], const float zyx[3])
void fbAnglesFromMatrix (float zyx[3], const float a[9])
int fbGetShort (const char *cp)
void fbPutShort (char *cp, int val)

Detailed Description

These are helper functions that convert data from one format to another in order to ease the decoding of data records sent by the flock.

Function Documentation

void fbMatrixFromAngles (  float  a[9],
const float  zyx[3]
) 
 

Convert euler angles into a 3x3 matrix.

Parameters:
a the nine matrix elements are stored here, column by column
zyx the three angles

void fbAnglesFromMatrix (  float  zyx[3],
const float  a[9]
) 
 

Does the opposite of fbMatrixFromAngles().

Parameters:
zyx the three angles are stored here
a the matrix

int fbGetShort (  const char *  cp  ) 
 

A helper function that concatenates two characters into an unsigned short.

Parameters:
cp pointer to the two characters
Returns:
the unsigned short value

void fbPutShort (  char *  cp,
int  val
) 
 

Store the low 16 bits of an integer in two bytes.

Parameters:
cp space to store the resulting two bytes
val the integer to convert
